intro: Vappodes leeana, commonly known as the Leeana mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaraceae. It is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and a distinctive, clustered growth habit. The plant typically attaches itself to the branches of host trees, such as those in the family Myrtaceae, through its haustoria. Vappodes leeana produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are fleshy berries that contain seeds dispersed by birds, contributing to its ecological role in forest ecosystems.
